{{Other uses|Lorelei (comics)}} {{Infobox comics character| |image =Lorelei (mutate).jpg |image_size =200 |caption = |character_name = Lorelei |real_name = Lani Ubana |species = [[Savage Land Mutates|Savage Land Mutate]] |publisher = [[Marvel Comics]] |debut =''The X-Men'' #63 (Dec. 1969) |creators = [[Roy Thomas]] (writer)
[[Neal Adams]] (artist) |alliances = [[Brotherhood of Evil Mutants]]
[[Savage Land Mutates]] |aliases = |powers = [[Hypnosis]] }} '''Lorelei''' ('''Lani Ubana''X-Men: Messiah Complex - Mutant Files''''') is a [[fictional character]] appearing in [[American comic book]]s published by [[Marvel Comics]]. ==Publication history== The character's first appearance was in ''[[Uncanny X-Men|The X-Men]]'' #63 (Dec. 1969), and was created by [[Roy Thomas]] and [[Neal Adams]]. The character subsequently appears in ''The Avengers'' #105 (Nov. 1972), ''The Defenders'' #15-16 (Sept.–Oct. 1974), ''The Uncanny X-Men'' #104 (April 1977), ''The Champions'' #17 (Jan. 1978), ''Super-Villain Team-Up'' #14 (Oct. 1977), ''Marvel Fanfare'' #1-4 (March–Sept. 1982), ''Captain America'' #415-417 (May–July 1993), ''X-Men: The Hidden Years'' #4 (March 2000), ''Cable & Deadpool'' #49 (March 2008), and ''Marvel Comics Presents'' #6-7 (April–May 2008). Lorelei appeared as part of the "Savage Land Mutates" entry in ''The [[Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe|Official Handbook of the Marvel Universe Deluxe Edition]]'' #11. ==Fictional character biography== Lorelei is a [[Savage Land]] native until [[Magneto (Marvel Comics)|Magneto]] turns her into a mutated siren, whose voice can put men into a [[hypnosis|hypnotic trance]], and she is placed in his [[Savage Land Mutates]] group. However, the machine that Magneto had used to empower his Savage Land creations is eventually destroyed. As a result, Lorelei lost her siren powers.''The X-Men'' #63 Some time later, she was seen with her powers somehow restored.''[[Defenders (comics)|The Defenders]]'' #15–16 She made a further appearance with the [[Brotherhood of Mutants|Brotherhood of Evil Mutants]].''[[Champions (1975 team)|The Champions]]'' #17 Years later, Lorelei was seen allied with the High Technician in the Savage Land. She battled [[Captain America]] and attempted to hypnotize the [[Falcon (comics)|Falcon]], but was quickly defeated by [[Diamondback (Rachel Leighton)|Diamondback]].''Captain America'' #415 (May 1993) Much later, she manipulated [[Ka-Zar (Kevin Plunder)|Ka-Zar]] to battle [[Deadpool]]. This was part of a mission to expand the dominion of the Savage Land. She uses many of the Land's inhabitants. Deadpool shoots her prehistoric ride and leaves her falling towards a group of dinosaurs. She survives this incident.''Cable & Deadpool'' #49 (March 2008) Lorelei helps chase out invading mercenaries.''Marvel Comics Presents'' #6-7 (April–May 2008) ==Powers and abilities== Lorelei can hypnotically paralyze men by singing, or manipulate them and place them under her control. Lorelei could also use her hair to immobilize her opponents,{{issue|date=June 2019}} however this power was stripped when her hair was cut by a mercenary.{{issue|date=June 2019}} ==Other versions== [[File:Lani Ubana.jpg|thumb|upright|Lorelei controlling [[Thor (comics)|Thor]], telling him to kill [[Valkyrie (Marvel Comics)|Valkyrie]] in ''The Ultimates 3''.
Art by [[Joe Madureira]]]] ===Ultimate Marvel=== Lorelei has appeared in the [[Ultimate Marvel|Ultimate universe]] as a member of the Brotherhood of Evil Mutants. She hypnotized [[Thor (Marvel Comics)|Thor]] into attacking [[Valkyrie (Marvel Comics)|Valkyrie]].''The Ultimates 3'' #2 She later passes herself off as the mother of the delusional terrorist [[Multiple Man]]; both are working for Magneto. The two are killed by [[Ultimate Wolverine|Wolverine]] in the Savage Land during [[Ultimatum (Ultimate Marvel)|Ultimatum]].''Ultimate X-Men'' #100 ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *{{Marvunapp|http://www.marvunapp.com/Appendix4/loreleislm.htm|Lorelei}} * {{Marveldatabase|Lani Ubanu}} {{Ultimate X-Men}} [[Category:Characters created by Neal Adams]] [[Category:Characters created by Roy Thomas]] [[Category:Comics characters introduced in 1969]] [[Category:Fictional characters who can manipulate sound]] [[Category:Fictional hypnotists and indoctrinators]] [[Category:Marvel Comics female supervillains]] [[Category:Marvel Comics mutates]]
